title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8.85 - Executive Order No. 85: Continuing the Suspension or Modification of Certain Statutory Provisions Relating to Payment of Fees for Duplicate State-Issued Documents and Extension of Expiration Dates
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8.85 - Executive Order No. 85: Continuing the Suspension or Modification of Certain Statutory Provisions Relating to Payment of Fees for Duplicate State-Issued Documents and Extension of Expiration Dates

State Regulations
WHEREAS, on October 26, 2012, I issued Executive Order

Number 47, declaring a disaster emergency in all 62 counties in the State of

New York; and
WHEREAS, Section
29-a
of the

Executive Law authorizes the suspension, alteration or modification of
statutes, local laws, ordinances, orders, rules or regulations, or parts
thereof, if compliance with such provisions would prevent, hinder or delay
action necessary to cope with a disaster emergency; and
WHEREAS, on November 5, 2012, I issued Executive Order

Number 62 to temporarily suspend certain provisions relating to the election
law, and which Executive Order will expire on December 5, 2012; and
WHEREAS, on November 9, 2012, I issued Executive Order

Number 69 to modify or suspend statutory provisions relating to payment of fees
for duplicate state-issued documents and extension of expiration dates of
certain state-issued documents to allow New Yorkers to replace documents
destroyed as a result of the disaster and avoid penalty for late renewal of
documents that they were unable to timely renew because of the disaster, and
which Executive Order will expire on December 9, 2012; and
WHEREAS, Section
29-a
of the

Executive Law provides that no suspension of laws shall be made for a period in
excess of thirty days, provided, however, that upon reconsideration of all of
the relevant facts and circumstances, the suspension may be extended for
additional thirty-day periods; NOW, THEREFORE, I, ANDREW M. CUOMO, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by Section 29-a of Article
2-B of the Executive Law, and after having reconsidered all of the relevant
facts and circumstances, do hereby order the following: The suspension of provisions of law ordered by Executive

Order Number 62 shall continue through January 4, 2013; The suspension of provisions of law ordered by Executive

Order Number 69 shall continue through January 8, 2013 except that the
suspension of the following provisions of the Vehicle and Traffic Law shall not
be continued: Section 301, subdivision (3) of Section 401, subdivision (3) of

Section 410, subdivision (2) of Section 491, subdivision (2) of Section 503, subdivision (4) of Section 2222, subdivision (9) of Section 2251, subdivision
(3) of Section 2261, and subdivision (4) of Section 2282; and

Subdivision 2 of Section
3006
of the

Education Law shall be suspended, for the period from the date of this

Executive Order until further notice, to the extent that it requires payment of
a fee for obtaining duplicate teaching certificates. Signed: Andrew M. Cuomo

Dated: December 4, 2012

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
8.85

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
